Class AccountController

  • java.lang.Object
    • Student_Services.User.AccountController
  • public class AccountController
extends java.lang.Object
    Login Controller gets an account username and verifies that the password associated is correct.

      • loginUser

        public static boolean loginUser​(java.lang.String username,
                                java.lang.String password)
        Method verifies that username exists and password is correct.
        Parameters:
        username - username provided by the user via log in page.
        password - password provided by the user via log in page.
        Returns:
        boolean that verifies the username and password exists in the database

      • getAccount

        public static Account getAccount​(java.lang.String username)
        Parameters:
        username - username of account to retrieve
        Returns:
        returns account object with given username

      • createUser

        public static boolean createUser​(java.lang.String username,
                                 java.lang.String password)
        Method creates a new user account
        Parameters:
        username - username to assign to account
        password - password to assign to account
        Returns:
        returns true if account was successfully created

      • usernameChecker

        public static boolean usernameChecker​(java.lang.String username)
        Parameters:
        username - username to check
        Returns:
        true if username meets criteria

      • passwordChecker

        public static boolean passwordChecker​(java.lang.String password)
        Checks if password meets criteria
        Parameters:
        password - password to check
        Returns:
        returns true if password criteria is met, otherwise false

      • setUserTable

        public static void setUserTable​(java.lang.String userTable)
        Sets the table the database controller will use for user lookups
        Parameters:
        userTable - table to use as user table
